tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
This psalm is a prayer for help.

tn.ref: In you, Yahweh, I take refuge
tn.text: Going to Yahweh for protection is spoken of as taking refuge in him. AT: "go to you, Yahweh, for protection" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: let me never be put to shame
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "never let my enemies put me to shame" See how "do not let me be humiliated" is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:025:001|25:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: make me safe in your righteousness
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "make me safe because you always do what is right" or 2) "make me safe as I do what you want me to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

Here "your ear" refers to God's willingness to hear someone who prays to him. AT: "pay attention to me." See how this is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:017:006|17:6]] (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Be to me a rock for refuge
tn.text: The psalmist requests that Yahweh make him as safe as he would be if he were hiding in a large rock or cliff where his enemies could not find him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These are hills or mountains, not rocks one can hold in one's hand.
"you have commanded your angels"
"keep me safe"

tn.ref: you are my rock and my fortress
tn.text: The psalmist believes that Yahweh will protect him and make him as safe as if he were hiding on top of a large mountain or inside a man-made fortress. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) the word "hand" is a metonym for power. AT: "from the power of the wicked, from the power of the unrighteous" or 2) "hand" refers to the person himself. AT: "from wicked people, from unrighteous ... people" or "so that wicked people and unrighteous ... people cannot harm me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous
tn.text: "wicked; rescue me out of the hand of the unrighteous." You can make clear the understood information. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
These adjectives can be translated as noun phrases. AT: "wicked people ... unrighteous people ... cruel people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
Here "hope" is a metonym for the one in whom the psalmist hopes. AT: "you are the one whom I confidently expect to help me" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: By you I have been supported from the womb
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You have supported me from the womb" or "You have taken care of me ever since I came out of my mother's womb" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"you are the one"

tn.ref: I am an example to many people
tn.text: "Many people see how I live and want to live as I do"

tn.ref: My mouth will be filled with your praise ... with your honor
tn.text: The psalmist speaks of his desire to praise and honor Yahweh with the words he speaks as if his mouth were full of words the way it can be full of food. AT: "My mouth will be filled with words that praise you ... that honor you" or "I will always praise you ... will always honor you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"words that tell people how great you are" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"words that cause people to honor you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"all day long" or "at all times"

tn.ref: Do not throw me away ... do not abandon me
tn.text: These two phrases have basically the same meaning and are used together for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

"Do not force me to go away from you." For God to reject him is spoken of as God forcing him to go away. AT: "do not reject me" (UDB) See how this is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:051:010|51:11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"do not leave me forever"
"are waiting for an opportunity to kill me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
"They say about me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"follow him when he runs away, and kill him"

tn.ref: do not be far from me
tn.text: "stay close to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
"help me soon"

tn.ref: Let them be put to shame and destroyed, those who are hostile to my life
tn.text: "Let those who are hostile to my life be put to shame and destroyed"

tn.ref: Let them be put to shame and destroyed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Put them to shame and destroy them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: those who are hostile to my life
tn.text: "those who accuse me of doing wrong" (see UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: let them be covered with rebuke and dishonor, those who seek my hurt
tn.text: "let those who seek my hurt be covered with rebuke and dishonor"

tn.ref: let them be covered with rebuke and dishonor
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "cover them with rebuke and dishonor." The nouns can be stated as verbs. AT: "may everyone rebuke them, and may no one honor them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"those who are looking for ways to harm me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"more all the time" or "always more than I have before"
The mouth is synecdoche for the whole person. AT: "I will tell" or "I will speak with my mouth and tell" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"how righteous you are" or "all the good things you do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"how you have saved me" or "how you save people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"even though"
Possible meanings are 1) "I will go to where people worship Yahweh" or 2) "I will go to my enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_go]])

tn.ref: with the mighty acts of the Lord Yahweh
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "I will tell them of the mighty deeds the Lord Yahweh has done" or 2) "because the Lord Yahweh has given me strength to do mighty acts."
"will talk about"
The implied information may be stated clearly. "taught me many things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"God, please do not forsake me"

tn.ref: I have been declaring your strength
tn.text: "I have been telling how strong you are" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"to those who are children today"

tn.ref: your power to everyone who is to come
tn.text: The omitted information may be stated clearly. AT: "and as I declare your power to everyone who is to come" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
This is hyperbole. AT: "so as many people as I can tell will know" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: Your righteousness also, God, is very high
tn.text: The psalmist speaks of the good things God has done as though they were put together as a high building or a mountain. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "there is no one like you!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"horrible troubles"
strengthen or make lively again

tn.ref: from the depths of the earth
tn.text: "The depths of the earth" is a metaphor for where people go when they die. The psalmist had not already died, but he speaks as if he had. AT: "when we are near death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: May you increase ... turn again and comfort
tn.text: "I want you to increase ... I want you to turn again and comfort." Some translations read, "You will increase ... you will turn again and comfort." (See UDB)
This describes one action through two phrases. AT: "comfort me again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hendiadys]])
"because I can trust you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: to you I will sing praises with the harp, Holy One of Israel
tn.text: "to you, who is the Holy One of Israel, I will sing praises while I play the harp"

tn.ref: My lips will shout for joy
tn.text: "Lips" is a metonym for the whole person. AT: "I will shout for joy" (see UDB)  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: even my soul, which you have redeemed
tn.text: The words the psalmist has omitted can be stated clearly. AT: "and my soul, which you have redeemed, will sing praises" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
Here "soul" refers to the whole person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "tongue" refers to the whole person. AT: "I will also talk" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: they have been put to shame and are confused, those who sought my hurt
tn.text: "those who sought my hurt  have been put to shame and are confused"

tn.ref: for they have been put to shame and are confused
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for God has put to shame and confused them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to the enemies of the writer. ([[:en:bible:notes:psa:071:008|71:10]]). See how "those who seek my hurt" is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:071:012|71:13]].
